titleStmt.title: A sermon, preached at St. Marie's in the University of Cambridge May 1st, 1653. Or, An essay to the discovery of the spirit of enthusiasme and pretended inspiration, that disturbs and strikes at the universities: by Joseph Sedgwick, Mr. of Arts, and Fellow of Christs Coll: in the University of Cambridge. Together with an appendix, wherein Mr. Del's Stumblingstone is briefly repli'd unto: and a fuller discourse of the use of universities and learning upon an ecclesiasticall account, submitted by the same authour to the judgement of every impartial and rational Christian.
titleStmt.author: Sedgwick, Joseph, 1628-1702.

titleStmt.title: A sermon, preached at St. Marie's in the University of Cambridge May 1st, 1653. Or, An essay to the discovery of the spirit of enthusiasme and pretended inspiration, that disturbs and strikes at the universities: by Joseph Sedgwick, Mr. of Arts, and Fellow of Christs Coll: in the University of Cambridge. Together with an appendix, wherein Mr. Del's Stumblingstone is briefly repli'd unto: and a fuller discourse of the use of universities and learning upon an ecclesiasticall account, submitted by the same authour to the judgement of every impartial and rational Christian.
titleStmt.author: Sedgwick, Joseph, 1628-1702.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by R.D. for Edward Story, bookseller in Cambridge,

notesStmt.note: "Episkopos didactikos, Learning's necessity to an able minister of the Gospel" (p. [27]-57) has separate dated t.p. and is filmed separately at reel 108:E.699[3].
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
